metadata.title: CVE-2017-5336 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the cdk_pk_get_keyid function inlib/opencdk/pubkey.c in GnuTLS before 3.3.26 and 3.5.x before 3.5.8 allowsremote attackers to have unspecified impact via a crafted OpenPGPcertificate.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5336` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnutls-bin - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2
guile-gnutls - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2
libgnutls-openssl27 - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2
libgnutls30 - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2
libgnutlsxx28 - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnutls28 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2').
